snippet: The size of the protests underlined the large section of society that has rejected the military intervention that deposed President Mohamed Morsi.
abstract: Hundreds of thousands of protesters in Egypt crowd public squares in Cairo and other cities as part of intensified campaign aimed at returning Mohamed Morsi to power; protests underline both the size of the opposition to the military’s intervention and the hardening split over the country’s direction.

byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The size of the protests underlined the large section of society that has rejected the military intervention that deposed President Mohamed Morsi.

headline.main: Hardening Split in Egypt as Islamists Stage Huge Demonstrations
headline.print_headline: Hardening Split in Egypt as Islamists Stage Huge Demonstrations

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
